Hi: I want to remove a BIOS password on my computer, how can help me ? Because I want to install windows/linux but I can't with the password
you generally need to reset the BIOS CMOS, which is a physical process that requires access to the internals of the machine
or you just enter the password and go to the BIOS setup
the former assumes that you're trying to avoid the password because you don't know it
I've removed the battery, wait 30 minutes, and replaced the battery but the BIOS password is always here
I don't have the BIOS password. :/
you can presumably remove the CMOS battery and that would reset it
Because When I restart the computer, I didn't have date and time but there is always password.
the regular laptop battery can be removed without affecting the CMOS, because it has a dedicated power source in the form of a large watch-type battery
if that doesn't work your only recourse would be to open it up and look for the CMOS reset jumper
And What CMOS reset jumper look like on laptop ?
surely that would depend on model
you should probably ask the person who set the password
